code:
# @param {Integer[]} nums
# @return {Integer}
def minimum_right_shifts(nums)
    # Check if the array is already sorted
    return 0 if nums.sort == nums

    # Find the index of the single potential break point
    break_point_index = nil
    nums.each_with_index do |num, i|
        if i > 0 && num < nums[i-1]
            # If we already found a break point, return -1 for impossible case
            return -1 if break_point_index
            break_point_index = i
        end
    end

    # If no break point was found (array is in descending order), return -1
    return -1 unless break_point_index

    # Check if the array can be sorted by a single right shift sequence
    # This means the part before the break point and the part after it, when put together, forms a sorted array
    sorted_array = nums[break_point_index..-1] + nums[0...break_point_index]
    return -1 unless sorted_array.sort == sorted_array

    # The number of shifts required is the length of the array minus the break point index
    nums.length - break_point_index
end
